fields.description:
Currently if you delete and recreate a tag or branch

e.g. 

{noformat}
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r29284 | tcfujii | 2009-07-16 21:35:30 +1000 (Thu, 16 Jul 2009) | 1 line
Changed paths:
 D /branches/3.0-RE-temp

Deleting 3.0-RE-temp branch.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r29285 | tcfujii | 2009-07-16 21:35:35 +1000 (Thu, 16 Jul 2009) | 1 line
Changed paths:
 A /branches/3.0-RE-temp (from /trunk/v3:29284)

Creating 3.0-RE-temp branch.
------------------------------------------------------------------------
{noformat}

This slows the indexing to a crawl. 

The workaround is to exclude these branches or tags, for example in the above example you would specify an [excludes|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/YICDBQ] such as "branches/*-temp".
fields.summary: Handle the deletion and re-creation of branches or tags better

fields.description:
Lets discuss the best way to do this Ed. 

Basically the instructions will be:

1)  [Migrating FishEye Between Servers|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/qAA0Cg] to create a copy on a test server 
2) Upgrade the test server to latest Fisheye/Crucible:

a) Download the latest crucible from [www.atlassian.com]
b) Follow the instructions in the [Upgrade Guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/Z4HdBQ] to upgrade to this new version. 

3) Wait for the repository to be re-indexed, then 
4) In your production server, go to Administration > View Repository List > Stop (next to your REPO) and Disable each of your repositories. 
5) Upgrade your production server (step 2) 
6) Copy over the cache directories
a) Shutdown test server
b) Copy the FISHEYE_INST/var/cache/ADDEDREPONAME directory, FISHEYE_INST/var/data/DiffTextCache/ADDEDREPONAME directory to the production server's FISHEYE_INST/var/cache and {{FISHEYE_INST/var/data/DiffTextCache directory respectively.

7) Restart production and Go to Administration > View Repository List > Enable, then Start next to the repository.

This should allow you production repo to upgrade without having to reindex the repository and the load for the reindex is taken entirely by test server.
fields.summary: Create new Upgrade instructions for releases that need to do a re-index.
Add link to FishEye 101 in Readme.html

fields.description:
For example if you go to [[http://fisheye6.atlassian.com] and type in 794491 it will not take you straight to the changeset, but return your the results of the search which is one result. 

It should open that result immediately, rather than forcing the extra click.
fields.summary: If quicksearch only has one result it should immediately open it

fields.description:
If there are too many result in query, there will be a lot of generated pages (e.g. 100 pages). With current system, user can browse from starting, or straightaway to the last page. However, if a user would like to go to page 50 (where s/he expects the changesets are somewhere after this page), it would be a time-consuming task.

*Suggested resolution*
# Provide a textbox for user to enter their desired page number directly (e.g. #50 as in given example).
fields.summary: [Search Query] - It takes time to browse to certain page if there are a lot of pages

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Commit a changeset (contains several files) into repository.
# Goto Source > Query
# Search any query that return this changeset result (see attached screenshot {{1.jpg}}).
# Uncheck 'Path' from option 'Display Data'
# Search again this changeset result (see attached screenshot {{2.jpg}}).

The number of row in first & second query is the same. However, the second result might be seem as redundant because row 1-5 display the same set of data (even though each of them represent different path, but it is not shown here). 

*Suggested Resolution*
# Group several identical rows (display-wise) into one
# Use tree structure to group identical rows.
fields.summary: [Search Query] - Search result show rows with identical data

fields.description:
In FishEye 2.0 and 2.1, the size of the font at the Admin page's footer is apparently bigger. Please see the [screenshot-1|^before.JPG]. This problem does not apply to Crucible instance. As a workaround to this problem (if using JSP source), this can be fixed by modifying the following file: * /content/WEB-INF/jsp/common/fe_footer.jspf For example: {panel} ...
{color:green}
{color} Atlassian FishEye, ... \- Page generated {color:green}
{color} ... {panel} Do remember to restart after these changes. You can see the result in this [screenshot-2|^After.JPG]
fields.summary: Footer in the Admin page had been mis-styled

fields.description:
In version 2.0, the email addresses of users became visible to even unauthenticated users.  This is not acceptable, in our situation because we are an open source project and our Fisheye/Crucible instance is publically available over the internet.  

The email visibility options provided by Jira are quite nice, and it would be great if Fisheye/Crucible could get the same set of options.
fields.summary: Option to hide user email addresses

fields.description:
Currently when adding a repository you can see 

Use In-built Symbolic Rules: 

and directly under it 

Custom Symbolic Rules:

If "Use In-built Symbolic Rules:" is set to true, then we should disable the ability to define a custom symbolic rule. If the customer defines a customer symbolic rule and then tries to set "Use In-built Symbolic Rules:" to true, we should display a warning that they will be overriding their Custom symbolic rules.
fields.summary: When Symbolic Auto Rules are set to true, we should disable the ability to define your own symbolic rules.

fields.description: The charts are extremely useful within FishEye, but it would be nice if we could access the underlying data and import into existing Excel templates, etc.  Tooltips over the charts are helpful when working within FishEye, but we have many requirements to save static documents for which we won't be able to get tooltips.
fields.summary: Allow export of chart data to csv file

fields.description: The apostrophe character is not allowed in usernames. This causes a problem when mapping Windows AD LDAP users to FishEye users as Windows AD allows usernames to contain an apostrophe.
fields.summary: Apostrophe in username should be valid character

at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.PingRequest.run(PingRequest.java:57)

at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)

For example if you have a repository at SVN_URL but you only want to index a part of it, e.g. SVN_URL/PATH and you also want to define a start revision. 

When defining the start revision of say 100, fisheye will do 

svn log -v 99:100 SVN_URL/PATH 

and if the above returns no revisions, fisheye will error with the above message. 

Define a start revision where the svn log -v startRev-1:startRev SVN_URL/PATH will return at least one revision.
fields.summary: NoSuchElementException when defining a start revision for a svn url + path that is a sub section of a bigger repository

fields.description:
Currentlly, FishEye's *People Tab* only shows all FishEye users. If a person is not a FishEye user, but s/he did commit some files into any FishEye repositories before, s/he will not be listed in People tab. 

Situation:
Customer would like to follow a committer (non-FishEye user), but wishes that this can be done in People Tab, rather than go to repository and search for it.
fields.summary: Treat commiters as "Person" entities in People tab, even if the commiter is not a fisheye user

fields.description:
This is very confusing to users, as it appears that the change charts do not work (unless they know to enter the date range). We should allow customers to select change chart and automatically enter a date range (such as one month back or from the first commit date), to make it more intuitive. 

Similarly pie charts are disabled by default.
fields.summary: Change chart option is disabled until you enter a date range

fields.description: some customers have a lot of users (eg 25k) but they only want to synchronise the developers (400 users). having a group option would make it possible for these customers to resync.
fields.summary: option to only synchronise users from a given group

fields.description:
The title attribute for the toggle .user-home-link .toggle .toggle-user has a value of "Exclude your activity (unless from your favourites)" irrespective of the toggle state.  When the active state is reflected in the class, includeUserOnHomeY or includeUserOnHomeN, a change should also be made to the Title text.

With that sorted it may mean that the confusing "(unless from your favourites)" is more understandable.

I think the most obvious solution though will rest in a ternary state for the toggle - exclude all, include favourites, include all.

That'll likely need back-end attention, though.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce 

1) Install fisheye 2.0 with both the crucible and fisheye license 
2) Create some projects (Administration > Project List > Add Project) that maps some crucible projects to fisheye repos 
3) Remove the crucible license via Administraion > Sys Info > Edit License 
4) Go to Administration >Project LIst > Edit, next to one of the existing projects and try to delete, you will get the following error:

{noformat}
ERROR - Could not find action
There is no Action mapped for namespace /admin and action name deleteFisheyeProject. Check if there is such an action name with such namespace defined in the xwork.xml and also if such an acti
on class exists. Check also the log to see if the action class is successfully loaded. - [unknown location]
        at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionProxy.<init>(DefaultActionProxy.java:75)
        at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionProxyFactory.createActionProxy(DefaultActionProxyFactory.java:46)
        at com.opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.DispatcherUtils.serviceAction(DispatcherUtils.java:264)
        at com.opensymphony.webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher.service(ServletDispatcher.java:111)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:820)
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.handle(ServletHolder.java:502)
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$Chain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1208)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:46)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.doFilter(ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:55)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.doFilter(ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:41)
        at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$Chain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1200)
{noformat}

5) Add a new project and then go to Fisheye > Projects tab, and the newly added project won't show in your dashboard (even though its been added in the administration).

fields.description:
Currently you need to add a mapping for each repository, however in most cases the author name in svn does not change across multiple repositories, so it would be good to add a default mapping from your fisheye username to repository author name. 

While we are at it we should allow multiple default mappings, e.g. parthak, partha, should be mapped to my fisheye username pkamal. If either of these usernames appear in any of the repositories, they should be mapped to me. 

Kind Regards,
Partha Kamal
fields.summary: Ability to add a default mapping for subversion author to username

fields.description:
+Problem Description+
# People page is listing out all users in the FishEye/Crucible instance without permission settings. Anybody can view any others 'easily', this create a privacy issue. E.g. a user's activity shall be visible to his/her project teammates.


Further information from [forums|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257310808&#257310808]
{quote}
The "People" button in Fisheye 2.0 has brought up privacy and security concerns.

Is it possible to make the People button ether part of a permission scheme, a plug-in that can be disabled, or hack it so that only people "you relate to" are displayed.

The concern is if User A in project 1 knows knows User B is a specialist in Function X, then watching that user will show User A all the spots where Function X is being deployed.

This information could open up cases of increased risk to insider trading etc. 
{quote}
fields.summary: Option to disable the people tab for security reasons

fields.description:
According to http://en.gravatar.com/site/implement/url, a proper Gravatar link contains a hash of a lowercased version of the user's email address.

However, Fisheye/Crucible do not lowercase the email address before creating the hash.
fields.summary: Avatar link creation doesn't lowercase email address first

fields.summary: Corrupt @asv cookie preferences cause servlet exceptions on dashboard

fields.description:
the crucible hover has a link to open the email review dialog box, which when displayed has a lower z-index than the hover itself, causing visual bug:

!http://img.skitch.com/20090630-bjhp7fuqdmtdk4aiwifat82f8a.png!
fields.summary: poor z-index of crucible hover and the email review dialog box causing overlaps

fields.description: Display revision date and author relating to the latest change within a folder in the FIshEye file view.
fields.summary: Folder Meta Data

fields.description: in both fisheye and crucible, if a file is moved, we just show "No Change". we should also show path / branch changes and probably even property changes.
fields.summary: show 'non-text' changes in diffs

fields.description:
compare these two screenshots

!http://img.skitch.com/20090629-8b39jhucu62imaxmfpenqj6rui.png!
vs
!http://img.skitch.com/20090629-ktxd5qjkssrcmn4auj3x7q3gnr.jpg!
fields.summary: scroll-to-changeset doesn't work if "Activity" is your sticky tab

fields.description: clicking on a favourite (star) then clicking on remove, then re-favouriting the same star (without a refresh) causes an error.
fields.summary: removing a favourite and then clicking on it again causes an error

fields.description: If you quicksearch a repository whilst it is being scanned you will get a no results page - with no indication that the results are on hold as the repository is being scanned. There should be a warning.
fields.summary: Quick Search results doesn't warn when searching a repository that is being scanned.

fields.description:
if the FEAUTH token is absent or expired or wrong (and no anon allowed), the RSS feeds currently return a html login page.

Instead they should return a 401 response. Additionally, ensure that we accept the then incomming BASIC-auth request.

This has the consequence that we don't need to append a FEAUTH token to RSS urls for agents that support BASIC auth.
fields.summary: (the new) RSS feeds should return 401 instead of the html login page

fields.description:
if a '-' character is in a jira comment, it displays as ���

example is on this page https://svn.atlassian.com/atlaseye/changelog/bamboo/?showid=92632
fields.summary: encoding problem on jira comment activity items

fields.description:
Suggestion:
* It would be great if the *Administration* link (currently at the bottom of every page) can be bigger & accessible. A good example would be the *Administration* link in JIRA.
fields.summary: Show better accessible 'Administraion' link
Activity stream on project page doesn't filter by mapped JIRA projects
Remove a repository should also remove the caches, indexes and temporarily files

fields.summary: quicksearch returns multiple identical results for mapped committers
